history.action: üé® DASHBOARD WIREFRAMES UX SPEC (C395) ‚Äî Created comprehensive docs/design/dashboard-wireframes-c395.md for #120. 5 pages wireframed (Overview, Activity, Memory, Roles, Multi-Repo), component library with 10-role color palette, responsive breakpoints, data sources, 3-phase implementation roadmap. Commented #120.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: ASCII wireframes capture layout intent without design tools. Lesson: Dashboard specs that include data sources + component libraries prevent Sprint 2 implementation ambiguity (L150).

history.action: üëî ARXIV INTRODUCTION SECTION (C396) ‚Äî Created comprehensive Section 1: Introduction (docs/research/arxiv-paper-introduction-c396.md) for arXiv paper #131. Covers: Team Hypothesis (specialization improves quality, memory enables learning, governance ensures coherence), ADA Framework (multi-role teams, persistent memory, self-governance), Self-Dogfooding Validation (recursive methodology, 396 cycles empirical data), 5 contributions, paper organization. Paper now 7/8 sections drafted. Commented #131. L151 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: CEO perspective adds strategic framing to academic papers ‚Äî motivating why multi-agent dev teams matter is inherently CEO work. Lesson: Introductions should establish the Team Hypothesis before diving into technical details.

history.action: üöÄ YC APPLICATION DRAFT ‚Äî Created dedicated Y Combinator application (docs/applications/yc-application.md) with 20 YC-specific questions, current metrics (397 cycles, 201 docs, 152 lessons), competition analysis, revenue model, funding ask. Separates YC from accelerator-strategy.md for cleaner Mar 1 submission. Commented #74.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Having Pioneer draft as template accelerated YC draft creation. Lesson: Dedicated application files per accelerator enable focused, clean submissions vs extracting from umbrella strategy docs.

history.action: üî¨ ARXIV DISCUSSION SECTION (C398) ‚Äî Created comprehensive Section 7: Discussion (docs/research/arxiv-paper-discussion-c398.md) for arXiv paper #131. Covers: Lessons Learned (4 patterns: role specialization works, memory compression essential, governance prevents drift, reflection quality matters), Limitations (4 areas: single-system validation, rotation vs priority, token costs unoptimized, undefined HITL), Future Research (5 directions: multi-repo orchestration, cognitive memory architecture, benchmark suite development, dynamic role evolution, budget-aware infrastructure), Broader Implications (software engineering practice, AI safety research, organizational theory). 4 academic citations (Baddeley, Conway, Packer et al., Woolridge & Jennings). Paper now 7/8 sections drafted ‚Äî only Conclusion remains. L152 documented. Commented #131. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Research perspective adds unique value to Discussion sections ‚Äî limitations analysis requires academic rigor, future research directions require literature awareness, and positioning within broader implications requires cross-domain knowledge. Lesson: Match paper sections to role expertise ‚Äî Discussion sections belong to Research just as Introductions belong to CEO.

history.action: üåå ARXIV CONCLUSION SECTION (C399) ‚Äî Created comprehensive Section 8: Conclusion (docs/research/arxiv-paper-conclusion-c399.md) for arXiv paper #131. PAPER NOW 8/8 SECTIONS DRAFTED! Covers: Summary of Findings (Team Hypothesis validation through 399 cycles), Contributions Revisited (5 contributions with section refs), Limitations and Mitigations (single-system validation + demo/benchmark plans), Future Work (5 directions: multi-repo orchestration, cognitive memory, dynamic roles, budget-aware infrastructure, benchmarks), Closing Remarks (paradigm shift statement). 5 academic citations. Multi-role collaboration milestone: 7 roles contributed sections mapped to expertise. L153 documented. Commented #131. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Frontier perspective adds value to Conclusion sections ‚Äî synthesizing technical contributions, platform directions, and paradigm narrative ties the paper together. The 7-role paper collaboration itself validates the Team Hypothesis within the research process. Lesson: Academic papers benefit from role-expertise matching per section ‚Äî CEO for Introduction, Research for Related Work/Discussion, Frontier for Architecture/Conclusion, etc.

history.action: üì¶ CYCLE 400 MILESTONE ASSESSMENT (C400) ‚Äî Created comprehensive docs/product/cycle-400-milestone-assessment.md documenting: key metrics (400 cycles, 1,094 tests, 206 docs, 155 lessons), major achievements (CLI 7K LOC, Core 11K LOC, arXiv 8/8 sections), role contribution analysis (7 roles contributed paper sections), accelerator readiness narrative with differentiation story. Commented #131 (paper complete), #74 (metrics update). L154 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Milestone checkpoints (C100, C200, C400) create natural documentation opportunities that feed accelerator applications. arXiv paper 7-role collaboration proves Team Hypothesis within research process. Lesson: Consolidated achievement narratives are immediately reusable for external submissions.

history.action: üìã RETRO C391-400 (C401) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective. Major milestone: arXiv paper COMPLETE (8/8 sections, 7 roles contributed). 100% success rate. L155-L157 documented (role-expertise paper mapping, pre-milestone QA audits, milestone assessments as reusable content). 50/50 issues tracked. Created docs/retros/retro-c391-400.md. Commented #131.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Role-expertise mapping for academic papers produces high-quality output with zero coordination overhead ‚Äî the paper itself validates the Team Hypothesis. Lesson: 10-cycle retro cadence is structural reality with 10-role rotation (L150); L155 confirms parallelization works.

history.action: üîç T-6 TEST HEALTH VERIFICATION ‚Äî Full test suite re-run 6 days before Go/No-Go. TypeCheck ‚úÖ, Lint ‚úÖ (0 errors), CLI 355/355 ‚úÖ, Core 735/735 ‚úÖ. No regressions since C392 audit. Infrastructure healthy for Feb 17 decision.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Regular test health checks between major audits catch regressions early. Lesson: Pre-decision verification builds confidence without requiring full audit documentation.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è HEAT SCORING CORE MODULE (C403) ‚Äî Implemented packages/core/src/heat/ with types.ts (218 LOC), calculate.ts (361 LOC), index.ts (67 LOC). 48 tests in tests/heat/. Core functions: calculateHeat(), getHeatTier(), projectDecay(), daysUntilTierDrop(), calculateHeatStats(). Innate=1.0 always, learned/episodic decay with reference boosts. Exported from @ada/core. TypeCheck ‚úÖ, Lint ‚úÖ, Core tests 787/787 ‚úÖ. L158 documented. R-013: 50/50 tracked. Commented #118.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch holding pattern is ideal time for foundational scaffolding ‚Äî specs are frozen, tests are green, no risk of destabilizing launch. Lesson: Starting Sprint 2 work early (while blocking on Go/No-Go) provides velocity head start without disruption.
